title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 29 February 2016 - XWiki
content:
<cjd> has quit  
00:36 <cjd> has joined #xwiki

09:09 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <Trefex\_> has quit  
09:20 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
09:21 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
10:11 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <mflorea> has quit  
10:14 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
10:15 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <vmassol> good morning  
10:27 <vmassol> tmortagne: a user has reported an issue on the list and I've tested it and it does sound weird: when you create a link in an existing page [[test]], it will create a sibling Nested Page instead of a children page.  
10:28 <vmassol> hmm I need to check someyhing  
10:28 <vmassol> I tested in a terminal page  
10:28 <vmassol> that's maybe why  
10:29 <vmassol> hmm no even in a NP it creates a sibling page instead of a children page  
10:29 <tmortagne> vmassol: terminal page or not the default is sibling, that's XWIKI-13060  
10:29 <vmassol> that issue is different  
10:29 <vmassol> it wasn't the purpose to create sibling pages  
10:30 <vmassol> the purpose was to be able to link to existing sibling pages  
10:30 <vmassol> but right now it's not normal  
10:30 <vmassol> I'll create a jira issue  
10:33 <vmassol> I've created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13148 for reporting it on behalf of the user, and for discussion  
10:51 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <vmassol> tmortagne: do we have a syntax ATM to force linking to a children page (without using an absolute path)?  
11:05 <tmortagne> .children  
11:05 <vmassol> I've tried [[.test]]  
11:05 <vmassol> but it doesn't work  
11:05 <vmassol> it links to the sibling NP  
11:06 <vmassol> (if it exists, didn't try if it doesn't exist)  
11:06 <tmortagne> hmm right the parser cannot make the different between test and .test, .test.WebHome works  
11:07 <tmortagne> but since that' what the syntax mean explicitely we need to fix it anyway  
11:08 <tmortagne> some special resolver might help  
11:08 <vmassol> hmm [[.test.WebHome]] doesn't work either  
11:09 <tmortagne> you are using snapshot or 7.4.1 ?  
11:09 <vmassol> master  
11:09 <vmassol> built from this moirning  
11:09 <vmassol> \*morning  
11:09 <tmortagne> there is no automatic resolve when the reference ends with "WebHome", so it just goes where the reference tells it to go  
11:10 <tmortagne> testing on my side  
11:10 <vmassol> I have [[.test.WebHome]] inside Test1.WebHome and it points to http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/test/  
11:11 <tmortagne> works well for me on 7.4.1, see http://tuska.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Test/Nested/  
11:11 <vmassol> try to create a sbling NP maybe  
11:11 <vmassol> testing that hypothesis too  
11:12 <tmortagne> hmm myxwiki.org is still on 7.4, weird  
11:12 <tmortagne> I tough it was upgraded  
11:12 <vmassol> ok  
11:12 <tmortagne> WebHome is not supposed to fallback on anything  
11:12 <vmassol> FTR it's the same if the sibling NP doesn't exist  
11:12 <vmassol> k  
11:12 <tmortagne> so it does not really care what exist and what does not  
11:25 <tmortagne> hmm found an issue, . is not supported anymore actually  
11:25 <tmortagne> crate a jira issue and looking at it  
11:27 <tmortagne> that's only on master I think, [[.test.WebHome]] should work well on 7.4.1  
11:28 <tmortagne> s/master/snapshot/  
11:28 <vmassol> ok  
11:28 <vmassol> thx  
11:34 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:37 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:04 <Trefex> has quit  
12:06 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
12:53 <vmassol> off for lunch  
13:13 <Bugendol1> has quit  
13:14 <Bugendolf> has joined #xwiki  
14:04 <vmassol> back  
14:21 <cjd> vmassol: what would you think of bridging this IRC channel with the channel #xwiki on matrix chat ?  
14:21 <cjd> btw you're invited :)  https://vector.im/beta/#/room/#xwiki:matrix.org  
14:21 <cjd> it's cool and feels like slack and it's also open source  
14:22 <vmassol> finishing something and I'll check it out to see what's it's about, thanks!  
15:19 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
15:31 <msmeria1> has quit  
15:41 <acotiuga> has quit  
16:01 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
16:04 <silverdrop> has quit  
16:05 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
16:53 <acotiuga> has quit  
17:00 <evalica> [release] Starting the 7.4.2 release  
17:00 <vmassol> evalica: has someone tested the changed done by Edy?  
17:00 <vmassol> (and thomas)  
17:00 <evalica> the ci?  
17:00 <evalica> the tests pass  
17:01 <vmassol> the ci only tests what tests are in there  
17:01 <vmassol> it's usually good to have a quick verification but you're the RM  
17:01 <vmassol> :)  
17:01 <evalica> I didn't know someone was supposed to tests those changes  
17:01 <vmassol> well  
17:01 <vmassol> you're releasing in a hurry  
17:01 <vmassol> we usually let more time to have problems surface  
17:01 <vmassol> so an extra check is never too much IMO  
17:01 <evalica> well we were supposed to release like 1 day ago :)  
17:01 <vmassol> you don't understand  
17:01 <vmassol> I'm trying to help you  
17:02 <vmassol> :)  
17:02 <evalica> :)  
17:02 <vmassol> if there's a problem you'll need to di it again tomorrow :)  
17:02 <vmassol> or in a few days  
17:02 <vmassol> anywaty  
17:02 <vmassol> if you're confident I'm fine  
17:02 <vmassol> you're the RM  
17:02 <vmassol> just telling you what I'd have done if it were me ;)  
17:03 <evalica> with this logic, the RM should test the whole release before releasing - anyway I understand  
17:05 <vmassol> as you know this is not possible  
17:05 <vmassol> so what I do as a RM is test the easy part that I know can lead to problems  
17:05 <vmassol> but I do a lot of testing indeed  
17:05 <vmassol> which you don't see here on this chat  
17:05 <vmassol> :)  
17:05 <vmassol> you only see the jira issue when a problem is found  
17:06 <vmassol> @evalica actually what you say is not true  
17:06 <evalica> k - I'll test rapidly a snapshot to see if there are problems  
17:06 <vmassol> the tests are done by:  
17:06 <vmassol> - community  
17:06 <vmassol> - other devs  
17:06 <vmassol> - manuel and co  
17:06 <vmassol> so it's not just the RM  
17:06 <tmortagne> evalica: you sure XWIKI-13151 is a flickering ?  
17:06 <vmassol> the RM is just repsonsible for the quality of the release  
17:08 <evalica> tmortagne: if you look at the history, you will see that it failed 5 builds ago and then passed. Eduard also said he seen it before. That's why I reported it as flicker.  
17:08 <tmortagne> ok  
17:09 <vmassol> anyway, evalica, I'm just suggesitng this here because I know these have been tested yet by anyone else than the devs who committed the fixes  
17:09 <vmassol> s/have/haven't  
17:09 <evalica> tmortagne: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform-7.4.x/lastBuild/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-panels-test-tests/testReport/org.xwiki.panels.test.ui/PanelTest/limitPanelViewRight/history/  
17:10 <evalica> vmassol: I understand - I'm a bit frustrated that is late and I tried to do other things. I would have liked to know that those issues need testing since I would have covered it sooner. I will test them.  
17:10 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
17:10 <vmassol> you couldn't have tested sooner, they jsut got 1) discovred and 2) fixed :)  
17:10 <vmassol> just = this morning  
17:11 <evalica> sooner like :) 30 minutes ago :) this messed my 'estimations' of starting the release at 18:00 :p  
17:11 <vmassol> and you don't need to test them, I'm just suggesting it, you can go ahead without testing if you're confident  
17:12 <vmassol> I'd have tested them myself but I don't have the setup locally ATM  
17:54 <vmassol> evalica: did you test [[.something]] and [[.sometihng.WebHome]]?  
17:55 <evalica> vmassol: https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13149?focusedCommentId=90232&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-90232 and https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13148?focusedCommentId=90234&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-90234  
17:55 <evalica> I want to start the release for 7.4.2  
17:57 <evalica> vmassol: do you think additional tests are needed? I tested some variations, I guess more tests can be made, but I would want to proceed with the release. WDYT?  
17:57 <vmassol> sure  
17:57 <evalica> k - startinh  
17:58 <vmassol> hmm  
18:02 <vmassol> I'm hesitating evalica  
18:02 <evalica> :)  
18:02 <evalica> I can wait until tomorrow  
18:02 <evalica> then  
18:02 <evalica> or I don't know, any suggestions? :)  
18:02 <vmassol> wait 2mn please  
18:02 <evalica> k  
18:03 <vmassol> it's related to https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13148?focusedCommentId=90235&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-90235  
18:04 <vmassol> but that would require substantial discussion/code changes probably  
18:04 <vmassol> so I think you should go ahread  
18:04 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:04 <vmassol> and if it's a problem we'll need to handle it through some legacy config param  
18:05 <evalica> vmassol: I've talked with Enygma` and he said that it's because of the backwards compatibility  
18:05 <evalica> so do I proceed? or we wait for tomorrow?  
18:06 <vmassol> I don't think we will solve this even tomorrow or in the coming week  
18:06 <vmassol> so you should go ahead IMO  
18:06 <evalica> k
